event_name: a16z AI Infra x AGI House Paper Reading Event
event_description: a16z AI Infra x AGI House: Deep Research Agents with Test-Time Diffusion ðŸ“ AGI House â€¢ ðŸ—“ Tech Week (Apply to attend. Space is limited.) The cutting edge of research agents is moving beyond simple search-and-retrieve. Googleâ€™s recent work on Test-Time Diffusion (https://arxiv.org/abs/2507.16075) proposes a new way to guide reasoning during inference, borrowing ideas from diffusion models to structure exploration and convergence at test time. This reading group will dive into: * The core idea: how diffusion-based sampling can steer large models to more consistent, high-quality reasoning outcomes. * Why it matters: implications for research agents, long-horizon planning, and reasoning reliability. * Hands-on discussion: strengths, limitations, and future extensions of the method compared to reinforcement learning and other alignment techniques. ðŸ”¬ Spotlight Paper Deep Research Agents with Test-Time Diffusion (Google Research, 2025) This will be a paper-style reading club session: short framing intro followed by collective discussion and critical analysis. Bring questions, skepticism, and ideas on where this approach could take us next. Hosted by AGI House x a16z AI Infra. Topics will include: â€¢ Kickoff: â€œAI is moving faster than law â€” should we regulate now?â€ â€¢ Debate: Innovation vs. guardrails (pros/cons). â€¢ Case studies: A few recent controversies (deepfakes, AI bias, copyright fights). â€¢ Ethics & power: What should AI never do? Who decides? â€¢ Forecast: Where is regulation most likely to land, and what does it mean for builders and investors? â€¢ Audience Q&A / poll: Do you want more or less AI regulation right now? event_name: Brisket, Bots, & Breakthroughs
event_description: Discover how Mindbeamâ€™s Litespark is setting a new industry barâ€”delivering up to 6x faster LLM pre-training, doubling token and batch throughput, and reducing energy costs by over 50% for both startups and enterprises. In this dynamic panel, Mindbeam founder Nii Osae, Principal Research Scientist Moinul Rahat, PhD, and Datology founder Ari Morcos will discuss how advances in training models and agentic AI make real-world deployment possible at scale. Join us by the fire(side) chat with BBQ to connect directly with the founders of Mindbeam and Datology, share bold ideas, and accelerate your LLM journey. What We Will Cover: - Analyze Mindbeamâ€™s Litespark improvements to training efficiency, including measured speed-ups in LLM pre-training, throughput, and resource utilization across practical ML workflows. - Examine Datologyâ€™s approach to agentic automation, synthetic data, and architectural implications for scalable, robust multi-modal models and real-world enterprise applications. - Review concrete deployment patterns for generative models, detailing the trade-offs, reproducible benchmarks, and lessons from actual implementations by technical teams. - Discuss case studies with a focus on design decisions, failure modes, and optimizations as experienced by organizations deploying Mindbeam and Datology in production settings. - Engage in a participatory Q&A: attendees are encouraged to raise deep technical issues, probe modeling choices, and share practical challenges with panelists who welcome nuanced discussionâ€”not surface-level hype. Speakers: - Nii Osae | 2nd time founder with 10+ years of experience in machine learning, applied neural cognitive architecture, scaling large AI applications. He published scientific research papers on efficient training of large language models and code-generating LLMs in collaboration with Nvidia, AWS, Huggingface, and ServiceNow. He is also a Forbes 30 Under 30 recipient. - Moinul Rahat, PhD | Moinul is an expert in Quantum Machine Learning (QML) and Quantum Optimization techniques to address complex challenges in particle physics and beyond. He has a PhD from the University of Florida, and was a Postdoctoral Fellow at University of Southampton and University of Valencia. He developed a hybrid Quantum Generative Adversarial Network (QGAN) architecture with a quantum generator and classical discriminator utilizing PennyLane and PyTorch. - Ari Morcos | Ari is the CEO and co-founder of DatologyAI, where the team is dedicated to helping customers build better AI models through improved data quality and methodology. Prior to founding DatologyAI, he served as a senior staff research scientist at Meta AI Research (FAIR Team) in Menlo Park, focusing on exploring the mechanisms underlying neural network computation and function, and leveraging these insights to advance intelligent machine learning system design. Join us by the fire(side) chat with BBQ to connect directly with the founders of Mindbeam and Datology, share bold ideas, and accelerate your LLM journey. Today we have AI wearables, screen recorders and pins. Tomorrow, we'll have chips in our brain reading our thoughts. How far are we from Minority Report (if it's not already here)? Come grill some meats and veggies in our backyard and discuss how we can share some of our most sensitive data with AI systems while maintaining some semblance of control and privacy. This event is for anyone who's trying to use AI but getting blocked because of privacy and security implications. Whether you work at a trading firm and can't use ChatGPT to implement your super secret quant algorithms, or you can't use Claude Code because your security team blocked it, this event is for you. What to expect: * Actual grilling in our actual backyard * Real talk about privacy-preserving AI from people shipping it * Good food, cold drinks Space is limited; approval required. Location in Lower Haight shared upon approval. This event is a part of #SFTechWeekâ€”a week of events hosted by VCs and startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

event_name: Agentic Memory & Context Engineering Hackathon
event_description: Weâ€™re excited to welcome you to the hackathon hosted by MongoDB! Todayâ€™s AI agents are only as good as the context they can hold onto. Traditional retrieval-augmented generation helps, but itâ€™s not enough to power persistent, adaptive, and truly agentic applications. This hackathon challenges developers, researchers, and builders to push the boundaries of context engineering (https://blog.langchain.com/context-engineering-for-agents/): the practice of designing how information is captured, stored, retrieved, and reused to extend an agentâ€™s memory and decision-making capabilities. In this hackathon, builders will reimagine how agents store, share, and recall information using MongoDB Atlas, Voyage AI, and their partners. Hackers will get hands-on support and work alongside some of the best builders in the AI community. Attendees will gain access to Atlas Vector Search (https://www.mongodb.com/products/platform/atlas-vector-search) and Voyage AI (https://www.voyageai.com/) embeddingsâ€” giving them what they need to push the limits of context, memory, and agentic applications. Winning teams will receive cash and credit prizes. Our speakers and judges will be some of the top names in the industry, and we will be announcing them soon... stay tuned! Note: This is a fully in-person event - remote teams are not allowed. This event is a part of #SFTechWeekâ€”a week of events hosted by VCs and startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. event_name: Deep Tech: The Future of Signal and AI
event_description: Join us for an evening at the edge of innovation, where founders, investors, and technologists come together to explore the frontiers of AI, robotics, defense, and privacy-preserving data technologies. This event will spotlight the future of signal and signal-less technologies; how we capture, protect, and reimagine data for the next generation of infrastructure in robotics, defense, and space. What to Expect Opening & Intros - Hear from the co-hosts shaping the space: RIFT-AR (privacy-first geospatial ML infrastructure) Arche Zero (total data automation) Fid Labs (AI agents for robotics) Pitching Session - 5 selected founders will deliver 5-minute pitches on cutting-edge AI/deeptech/data startups, with live Q&A from a panel of expert judges. Audience Choice Award - You decide the winner. Cast your vote via QR code. Networking & Music - After the pitches, stay for snacks, non-alcoholic and music in a relaxed environment designed to spark connections among investors, founders, and deeptech builders. Who Should Join Founders building AI, deeptech, or data-driven companies Early-stage & venture investors scouting bold ideas Engineers, technologists & students passionate about infrastructure and the future of data Why Attend Our goal is to create a high-energy yet thoughtful space where visionary ideas in AI and deeptech can be tested, challenged, and celebrated. By blending live pitching with real conversations on the role of data, privacy, and infrastructure, weâ€™re building a stage for the next generation of breakthrough companies. This is an inclusive, engaging event, designed to give early-stage builders visibility in front of peers, investors, and technologists. About Hosts: RIFT-AR Technologies:(https://www.riftartech.com/) A New Yorkâ€“based startup developing privacy-preserving geospatial infrastructure that redefines real-time location accuracy beyond GPS. RIFT-AR builds foundational technology for the future of AR, robotics, logistics, and industrial systems through machine learning, sensor fusion, and ethical data frameworks. Arche Zero (https://archezero.com/): Arche Zero transforms complex data into clear, actionable intelligence by combining satellite insights, IoT sensors, and AI analytics. Arche Zero empowers financial institutions, insurers, and investors to manage risk, ensure compliance, and unlock new market opportunities in the evolving landscape of global finance. Fid Labs (https://www.fidlabs.ai/) Fid agents automate tedious robotics tasks like integrating sensors, searching through spec sheets, or triaging errors. Fid enables agents to understand your hardware stack, letting you automate busywork and focus on shipping robots faster. If you would like to submit your pitch and have a chance to present submit to: K.fedorowicz@riftartech.com By Oct 1st. This event is a part of #SFTechWeekâ€”a week of events hosted by VCs and startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

event_name: How to be visible to AI Search
event_description: AI-powered platforms are reshaping how tech companies gain visibility, with ChatGPT leading referral traffic across industries and Perplexity and Gemini gaining ground in specific verticals. Decision-makers increasingly consult AI systems before traditional search engines, and zero-click searches now account for some 60% of all Google searches, per a recent SparkToro study. If your company isn't surfacing in these AI responses, you're effectively invisible. The central question: How can a tech startup position themselves as authoritative source within AI knowledge systems? Join Axxilion for an exclusive webinar where tech founders will discover how to position your company and its executives as credible, citable sources to dominate the new media landscape. This intimate gathering will reveal the hybrid optimization strategies that successful startups are using to build authority across both traditional and AI-driven search. Who Should Attend: Tech startup and scale-up founders and executives who want to future-proof their brand visibility in the rapidly evolving search ecosystem. Why Attend: This session addresses the evolving intersection of public relations, media strategy, and AI-powered information discovery. This event is a part of #SFTechWeekâ€”a week of events hosted by VCs and startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

With AI reshaping industries at unprecedented speed, we are in a pivotal moment to understand and build strategies that look at the human rights implications of tech investments. Now is the time for intentional conversations across the spectrum, from tech investors to digital rights organizations, so we can develop strategies to embed human rights considerations into tech investment approaches while supporting the companies and investors leading in their consideration of their societal impact. This workshop presents a compelling, data-driven discussion around the business case for human rights-respecting investments, offering investors actionable insights to drive outperformance and reduce exposure to unrewarded risk. event_description: Join XR's leading innovators to dive into how AI-driven hardware is crafting a digital reality surpassing the natural world. Communicate in person, share your insights and lessons on what it truly takes to â€œbuildâ€ - the highs, the lows, and everything in between. ðŸ‘€ EuReality Event: We help founders create momentum with bold visions and craftsmanship mindset in the digital reality era. â€” â€œIf a tree falls in the forest and no one hears it, did it happen?â€ ------ Behind the Name: EuReality is the next frontierâ€”a collective, interdependent digital reality where intelligent machines and synthetic data cooperate seamlessly to create a reality beyond the natural. The past few decades, defined by the fifth Kondratiev wave, marked the small-information era of electronics and the Internet. The coming sixth wave will ignite the big-information era, powered by autonomous intelligent machinesâ€”hardware in the physical worldâ€”that will transform how humanity lives, works, and imagines the future. Looking further ahead, guided by First Principles that technology evolves in a â€˜Left-Right-Leftâ€™ cycle, the next wave will bring the intelligent revolution. Robots, drones, aircrafts, and autonomous vehicles will generate vast streams of synthetic data, pushing a profound upgrade of the digital realm and crafting a digital reality that surpasses the natural world. Now is the critical window to shape this future. We stand at a paradigm crossroads: from â€œhuman value comes from our laborâ€ to â€œhuman value comes from who we are.â€ I believe in this shift, and I have named it EuReality. Inspired by eusocialityâ€”the highest form of social organization in biology, where individuals thrive through cooperation, specialization, and shared purposeâ€”eureality reimagines this principle for technology. event_name: The AI Prototyping Revolution: Build, Test, and Iterate Faster than Ever
event_description: This event is organized by Reforge and NextView. Join us to explore how AI is revolutionizing product development. This session, led by Brian Balfour, Sachin Rekhi, & Rob Go, will delve into the "AI Prototyping Mastery Ladder," guiding you through different levels of proficiency. Discover essential tools that facilitate efficient, AI-powered prototyping and understand the compelling reasons why prototyping is now non-negotiable and crucial for enhancing product development. AI prototyping isn't just a tool, it's a game-changer, fundamentally reshaping product strategy for faster, smarter creation. ABOUT BRIAN BALFOUR Brian is the Founder/CEO at Reforge. Before that, he was VP of Growth at Hubspot, focusing on new product initiatives such as the HubSpot Sales and HubSpot CRM products. Brian has been a co-founder of 4 companies in the past 10 years. He is also an advisor/investor to Drift, Loom, Pipefy, Wonder School, VoiceOps, Kettle & Fire, Gametime, Helpscout, Blue Bottle Coffee (acquired by Nestle), Namo Media (Acquired by Twitter), Grabcad (acquired by Stratasys) and many more. ABOUT SACHIN REKHI Sachin is a Course Creator at Reforge, where he developed the "Mastering AI Productivity" course teaching product managers how to leverage AI to gain superpowers beyond their traditional role. As Founder & CEO of Notejoy and former Head of Product at LinkedIn, Sachin has over 15 years of experience building and scaling products, including incubating LinkedIn Sales Navigator, which grew to over $200 million annual run-rate. He's a prolific thought leader in product management, having written 175+ essays with over 3 million views. ABOUT ROB GO Rob is a Partner and Co-founder of NextView Ventures, a seed-stage venture capital firm focused on investing in companies that leverage software and AI to tackle mass-market human problems. Since co-founding NextView in 2010, Rob has led investments in companies like Reforge, Setpoint, and The Browser Company. Prior to NextView, Rob was a principal at Spark Capital and worked in business development at eBay, where he launched over 20 products that enhanced search, browse, and merchandising capabilities. ABOUT NEXTVIEW VENTURES â€‹NextView Ventures is a high-conviction, hands-on venture capital firm that helps entrepreneurs build companies of consequence to shape a future of collective prosperity. NextView specializes in leading seed and pre-seed rounds in pre-traction businesses that leverage software and AI to tackle mass-market human problems. Since 2011, NextView has invested in 200+ portfolio companies nationally, including Attentive, ThredUP, WHOOP, Devoted Health, Setpoint, TripleLift, Reforge, and Bobbie. ABOUT REFORGE Reforge is evolving to empower product teams beyond education. Alongside expert training, Reforge offers AI-powered tools designed to help product teams ship high-quality software faster. With three innovative tools already launched and more on the way, we combine cutting-edge software with the earned insights of the worldâ€™s top practitioners. ABOUT STIFEL â€‹â€‹â€‹Stifel Venture Bank is a trusted partner to founders and fund managers, providing commercial banking services and debt financing solutions to venture-backed companies and their investors. Stifelâ€™s highly experienced team brings a relationship-based approach to banking, and enjoys being a strategic partner for clients by delivering valuable events, insightful content, and access to the broader Stifel (NYSE: SF) platform, including equity analyst research, investment banking and wealth management groups. event_name: Perform at your Peak
event_description: Positive Intelligence Quotient (PQ) measures â€œmental fitness,â€ which is your ability to respond to challenges with clarity and strength. It is about activating your inner sage through curiosity, empathy, and creativity while quieting your inner saboteurs such as self-doubt, perfectionism, over-control, or avoidance. Tech professionals will explore how Positive Intelligence impacts peak performance, resilience, and relationships at work. WHY IT MATTERS With many shifts in the world, the economy, and the workplace, markets adjust, strategies pivot, teams reorganize, and AI accelerates possibilities and the unknown. ðŸŽ¯ Many leaders are left asking the same question: How do I and my team stay focused and perform on what truly matters? âœ¨ In high-pressure environments, performance is not just about effort: it is about energy. Leaders who strengthen their mental fitness not only deliver stronger results but also sustain their own well-being and build higher-performing teams. ðŸ“ˆ Research on PQ shows that improving mental fitness can increase: Â· team performance by 30% Â· sales performance by 40% INTERACTIVE DISCUSSION In a facilitated conversation, attendees will: Â· Identify their dominant saboteurs and sage patterns Â· Share insights on how these patterns play out in daily leadership Â· Learn practical strategies to build resilience, strengthen decision-making, and lead teams with greater presence and impact Speakers and facilitators will include: Â· Shirley Braun, Ph.D., Managing Partner at Swift Insights Â· Mary Beth Snodgrass, Managing Director at the Product Advisory Collective (PAC) PRE-WORK BEFORE EVENT (10 mins) Attendees are encouraged to take the PQ Assessment (http://positiveintelligence.com/), created by Shirzad Chamine, a Stanford-educated, widely-recognized executive coach (watch TedTalk (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-zdJ1ubvoXs). Completing this before the session will maximize value gained. SESSION AGENDA (75 minutes) 1. Introduction (5 min): Why mental fitness matters in high-pressure environments 2. Intelligent Leadership Primer (10 min): Overview of the ten saboteurs, their traits, and how they show up at work and Q&A with audience. 3. Group Breakout Discussion (20 min): Attendees join groups based on the top saboteurs identified by the assessment for in-depth discussions. 4. Facilitated Discussion (15 min): Group representatives share highlights of discussions. Facilitator highlights overlapping patterns and differences. 5. Increase Resilience and Wisdom Practice (10 min): Facilitator guides individuals on how they can redirect from saboteur to sage in the moment. 6. Wrap-Up (5 min) This event is a part of #SFTechWeekâ€”a week of events hosted by VCs and startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

event_name: Startup Poker 2.0 - Founders and Investors Only
event_description: This event is for full-time venture scale founders and investors. Event tickets (separate from optional cash poker buy-in) for members are only $10, if you are already a member, register in your startuphaven.com dashboard. If you are not yet a member, apply here: startuphaven.com/levels. Note that this event is exclusively for startup founders and investors. Please do not bring unregistered guests, thank you. What You Need to Know For everyone: This is not an event just for poker players, but for players and non-players of poker alike. Please come just to enjoy the food and drinks as well. For our poker players: MAKE SURE TO BRING CASH, buy-in starts at $10. Beginner poker players are encouraged to attend: This is a friendly, inclusive game of low-stakes poker. Random and Guaranteed Poker Seats: In the event that more than 24 attendees want to play poker, Level 2 members will be settled first and then we will cut cards for the remaining seats. Details on the poker game can be found here: (Poker Basics Webpage https://startuphaven.com/startup-haven-poker-event-basic) If you're new to Startup Haven events, familiarize yourself with the details by reviewing the (Startup Haven Event Basics https://startuphaven.com/startup-haven-event-basics/) We strongly encourage women, people of color, and individuals from all under-recognized groups to join us. We acknowledge that poker, as well as the tech and startup community, has historically been male-dominated. However, we are committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive environment for all members and players. See more in our statement of inclusivity below. What to Expect Dinner and Networking Dinner is casual and catered, available at 5:30 or whenever you arrive. Serve yourself when you arrive and enjoy a drink while mingling or sitting. We strive to provide delicious food with a vegetarian option. "No pizza" rule. Ask and Offer This is a quick and optional activity that gives people the opportunity to introduce themselves and share their "ask" and their "offer" to the community. We can all offer expertise, introductions, or experience. Guest Speaker, Bob Crimmins â€‹About me. I am a 4x founder turned investor. I am the GP of Startup Haven Ventures, a pre-seed venture capital fund. In addition to direct investments, we also invest through our accelerator program. I founded the Startup Haven network in 2006 as a passion project to help build relationships between founders and investors. Host: Startup Haven Startup Haven Ventures is a pre-seed venture fund backed by its 19-year-strong, members-only national network exclusively for full-time, venture-scale founders and active investors. Our gatherings provide a private spaceâ€”no service providers allowedâ€”where founders and investors can exchange ideas and build meaningful relationships. In our New York chapter, we host a monthly dinner and an inclusive poker night, plus virtual programs like Office Hours and Pitch Coaching to connect founders nationwide. Learn more at startuphaven.com. Startup Haven Premium Events: Founders Dinner and Startup Poker 2.0 This event is free for Startup Haven Level 1 & Level 2 members, but Level 0 members have a cost of $10.00. If you would like to attend this (and future) premium events for free, upgrade to Level 1 ($10/month) or Level 2 ($30/month) here: (UPGRADE http://member.startuphaven.com/sys/membershiplevelchange) Startup Haven events are (usually) exclusively for our founder and investor members. If you are interested in joining Startup Haven as a free member, you can indicate that in your registration questions! Safety Concerns If you have safety concerns and would like someone to accompany you to your vehicle, we would be happy to accommodate you, just let one of our team members know or email us in advance at membership@startuphaven.com. Thank you! If you are sick, or have loved ones that are vulnerable, please consider coming to future events instead. Sponsors Make it Happen Thank you to our venue sponsor WorkHouse! WorkHouse has 18 different meeting room spaces over 12 floors for member use and a variety of event spaces. Each space is uniquely designed and curated. Startup Haven and these events would not be possible without the support of our awesome sponsors. They buy all the food, drink, poker chips, cards, trophies, etc. so please thank them when you see them! Inclusivity We acknowledge that poker, as well as the tech and startup community, has historically been male-dominated. However, we are committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive environment for all members and players. We strongly encourage women, people of color, and individuals from all under-recognized groups to join us at our events. Your presence enriches the experience for everyone, and we are dedicated to ensuring that our poker community is diverse, respectful, and inclusive. Read here (https://medium.com/@bcrimmins/why-every-startup-founder-should-play-poker-1-of-3-94a5f543170a) for more about why we play poker at Startup Haven, and believe that poker is for everyone. This event is a part of #SFTechWeekâ€”a week of events hosted by VCs and startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

For developers building AI agents, founders who need production deployments, and anyone who's done with demos that don't scale. Acceptance on a rolling basis. Location revealed 24 hours before. event_name: Verifiers - Fireside Chat with Will Brown
event_description: No slides, no pitches, just war stories, patterns and anti patterns from the engineers who built RL verifiers. In RLVR, the policy learns whatever the verifier rewards. If the verifier is leaky, exploitable, or miscalibrated, youâ€™re training on lies. This fireside is a candid, practitioner-level dive with builder who have shipped multiple verifiers across tasks (safety, code, tool use). Weâ€™ll hit: - What a good verifier actually is: pairwise vs scalar scoring, sparse rewards, decomposition etc. - Generalization under shift: preventing policy-chasing, leakage, and â€œreward hacking by spec ambiguity.â€ - Calibration & coverage: thresholds, selective prediction, human-in-the-loop only where it moves expected utility. - Sparse reward tasks: how to design verifiers when feedback is naturally scarce - detecting rare successes, using proxy signals without collapsing to spec drift, and tricks like trajectory-level verification or hierarchical reward shaping. - If time permits: RL environments and how verifiers are the key. Non-consensus takes weâ€™ll debate: - Verifiers should abstain a lot more (prevent the model from training on the wrong signal) - Train/Configure verifiers on artifacts (traces/tests), not just text. - Optimize for uncertainty quality, not mean score. Who should come: folks shipping LLMs, agents, RLVR stacks; anyone whoâ€™s been burned by a â€œgoodâ€ reward model. event_name: Just use Postgres (and DuckDB): a Postgres + DuckDB Community Night
event_description: Elephants, ducks, weâ€™re all from the same zoo. Join us for an evening exploring how PostgreSQL and DuckDB work better together! We'll feature talks on integrating DuckDB with existing PostgreSQL workflows, scaling analytics workloads, combining both tools for data engineering use cases, and more. The evening will include technical talks, networking, and discussions about the future of OLAP and OLTP working in harmony â€“ co-hosted by MotherDuck and Dagster! Agenda: **Just use Postgres (and DuckDB)** The most effective data stacks are often the simplest. This talk demonstrates how combining Postgres and DuckDB creates an elegant and robust platform, freeing you to focus on solving customer problems instead of wrestling with infrastructure. presented by Jacob Matson, Developer Advocate @ MotherDuck **Stop Fighting Your Data Platform: Modern Orchestration for High-Velocity Teams** The modern data landscape demands a new approach: specialized tools working in harmony rather than monolithic solutions trying to do everything. But how do you actually build a stack that delivers on this promise?This talk explores three fundamental principles transforming how we build data platforms: choosing the right tool for each specific job, developing locally before deploying globally, and maintaining unified observability across your entire ecosystem.Through the lens of PostgreSQL's transactional reliability, DuckDB's analytical speed, and Dagster's orchestration intelligence, you'll see how these principles create platforms that scale from your laptop to production while giving teams the visibility and confidence they need to ship reliably. presented by Alex Noonan, Developer Advocate @ Dagster Labs #SFTechWeek This event is a part of #SFTechWeekâ€”a week of events hosted by VCs and startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.
